intro: Lupinus amniculi-salicis, commonly known as the Salicis River Lupine, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and stream sides. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
